Dgame.Graphics.TileMap



struct TileMapInfo;
This structure stores information about the tile map properties

string source;
The map filename

ushort width;
The map width in pixel

ushort height;
The map height in pixel

ushort[2] mapSize;
The map size

ubyte tileWidth;
The tile width in pixel (for example: 16, 32, 64)

ubyte tileHeight;
The tile height in pixel

struct Tile;
The Tile structure contains informations about every tile on the map

const ushort gid;
The gid is the Tile id. It contains the positions of this tile on the tileset. 
const uint tilesPerRow = mapWidth / tileWidth;

uint y = gid / tilesPerRow;
uint x = gid % tilesPerRow;


string layer;
The layer of the tile, if any

const ushort[2] pixelCoords;
The coordinates in pixel of this tile on the map

const ushort[2] tileCoords;
The coordinates of this tile on the map

class TileMap: Dgame.Graphics.Drawable.Drawable, Dgame.Graphics.Interface.Transformable.Transformable;
The Tile map consist of tiles which are stored in a XML file (preferably build with tiled)

author:
rschuett

const bool compress;
If compress is true, only the needed Tiles are stored (which means that are new tileset is created which contains only the needed tiles) otherwise the whole tileset is taken.

final this(string filename, bool compress = true);
CTor

If compress is true, only the needed Tiles are stored (which means that are new tileset is created which contains only the needed tiles) otherwise the whole tileset is taken.

const short[2] convertCoords(T)(ref const Vector2!(T) vec);
Convert from pixel coordinates to tile coordinates.

const short[2] convertCoords(T)(T[2] coords);
Convert from pixel coordinates to tile coordinates.

const short[2] reconvertCoords(T)(ref const Vector2!(T) vec);
Convert from tile coordinates to pixel coordinates.

const short[2] reconvertCoords(T)(T[2] coords);
Convert from tile coordinates to pixel coordinates.

const short[2] adjustCoords(T)(ref const Vector2!(T) vec);
Adjusted pixel coordinates so that they lie on valid pixel coordinates based on tile coordinates.

const short[2] adjustCoords(T)(T[2] coords);
Adjusted pixel coordinates so that they lie on valid pixel coordinates based on tile coordinates.

final void reload(const Vector2s[] coords, const Vector2s[] newCoords);
Reload multiple tiles. The length of coords must be equal to the length of newCoords.

See:
reload for one tile

final void reload(const Vector2s[] coords, ref const Vector2s newCoord);
Replace multiple tiles with another.

final void reload(const Vector2s[] coords, const Vector2s newCoord);
Rvalue version

final void reload(ref const Vector2s coord, ref const Vector2s newCoord);
Reload one tile, which means that the tile on the coordinates coord is replaced with the tile (and the tile surface) on the coordinates newCoord

final void reload(const Vector2s coord, const Vector2s newCoord);
Rvalue version

final void exchangeTileset(Texture tex);
Exchange the tileset

final inout inout(Tile[]) getTiles();
Returns all containing tiles

final const pure nothrow bool isTileAt(ref const Vector2s vec, uint* idx = null);
Check whether a tile exist on the given Coordinates. If idx isn't null, the calculated index of the Tile at the given position is stored there.

Note:
The position must be in tile coordinates, not pixel coordinates.

final const pure nothrow bool isTileAt(short[2] tilePos, uint* idx = null);
Check whether a tile exist on the given Coordinates. If idx isn't null, the calculated index of the Tile at the given position is stored there.

Note:
The position must be in tile coordinates, not pixel coordinates.

final const pure nothrow bool isTileAt(short x, short y, uint* idx = null);
Check whether a tile exist on the given Coordinates. If idx isn't null, the calculated index of the Tile at the given position is stored there.

Note:
The position must be in tile coordinates, not pixel coordinates.

final void replaceTileAt(ref const Vector2s vec, ref const Tile newTile, Tile* oldTile = null);
Replace the tile at the given position with the given new Tile. If oldtile is not null, the former Tile is stored there.

Note:
This method is designated as helper method for reload

Note:
The position must be in tile coordinates, not pixel coordinates.

final void replaceTileAt(short[2] tilePos, ref const Tile newTile, Tile* oldTile = null);
Replace the tile at the given position with the given new Tile. If oldtile is not null, the former Tile is stored there.

Note:
This method is designated as helper method for reload

Note:
The position must be in tile coordinates, not pixel coordinates.

final void replaceTileAt(short x, short y, ref const Tile newTile, Tile* oldTile = null);
Replace the tile at the given position with the given new Tile. If oldtile is not null, the former Tile is stored there.

Note:
This method is designated as helper method for reload

Note:
The position must be in tile coordinates, not pixel coordinates.

final const ref const(Tile) getTileAt(ref const Vector2s vec);
Returns the tile at the given position, or throw an Exception

Note:
The position must be in tile coordinates, not pixel coordinates.

final const ref const(Tile) getTileAt(short[2] tilePos);
Returns the tile at the given position, or throw an Exception

Note:
The position must be in tile coordinates, not pixel coordinates.

Note:
This function is fast and takes ~ O(1) for a lookup.

final const ref const(Tile) getTileAt(short x, short y);
Returns the tile at the given position, or throw an Exception

Note:
The position must be in tile coordinates, not pixel coordinates.

final const pure nothrow ref const(TileMapInfo) getInfo();
Returns the information structure of this tilemap

final const pure nothrow string getFilename();
Returns the .xml filename of this tilemap
